Footnotes:

column2: Month-end statement of funds advanced and outstanding balances vis-à-vis new and existing loans, booked in Canada, in Canadian dollars only, to Canadian households and businesses sectors by chartered banks.
Funds advanced represents the cumulative total of new credit extended, new draws on existing credit facilities, mortgage or term-loan renewals and refinancing for a given month.
Outstanding balances are reported as month-end accounting book values, gross of allowances for expected credit losses.
Data collection on outstanding balances, auto-loans, open and closed variable rate residential mortgages began in July 2016.
Interest-rates are calculated by a volume-weighted average, cross-sectioned on reporting institutions for a given month.
The funds advanced and outstanding balance section classify amounts across terms based on the term set at loan origination.
As of January 2019, insured and uninsured residential mortgages exclude residential mortgages to the corporate sector.
As of January 2019, Total business loans exclude non-residential mortgages to the personal sector.
